result.execSummary:
The defendant Elliot Matthews Hanna was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to count 4, with credit for 182 DAYS time served. A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

-DV assessment imposed.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges and restitution, to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment subject to any applicable collection procedures. 
-Court WAIVES all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 10/18/22.
Probation Review hearing on January 6, 2023.

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

- Absolute sobriety with random UA's and SCRAM.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elliot Matthews Hanna

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Elliot Matthews Hanna appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Elliot Matthews Hanna.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea and sentencing hearing held. Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding his/her right to have an in-person hearing. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 1 AND 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered the Domestic Abuse Repeater Enhancer in COUNTS 2 and 4 DISMISSED.

AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 4: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2: The court sentenced the defendant to serve 182 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 4, with credit for 182 DAYS time served. A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

AS TO COUNT 4: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 YEARS AND 6 MONTHS, consecutive to count 2, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR AND 6 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 180 DAYS in HOC as Condition Time, STAYED pending review, as to count 4.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety with random UA's and SCRAM.
-No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
-Third party contact for purpose of time with the children.
-Follow 22FA2143 exactly as written.
-No contact with firearms.
-DV assessment imposed.
-Pay restitution in the amount of $763.30 to K.A.R.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges and restitution, to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment subject to any applicable collection procedures. 
-Court WAIVES all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 10/18/22.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Elliot Matthews Hanna in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Elliot Matthews Hanna in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Elliot Matthews Hanna appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29. Court dismiss Domestic Abuse Repeater enhancer for counts 1 and 4, (939.621(1)(b)). Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
